New Records: Emmanuel Clase matched Cody Allen's franchise record with 149 saves
Erceg was charged with one run allowed, his first in 12 appearances and 13 1/3 innings since joining Kansas City in a July 30 trade with Oakland
Key Match Events: Jhonkensy Noel singled home Josh Naylor with the go-ahead run in the seventh inning
Bo Naylor homered off starter Michael Wacha
Josh Naylor, Will Brennan and Noel had RBI singles against Lucas Erceg
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals had their seven-game road winning streak snapped
Kansas City had clinched the season tiebreaker over the Guardians
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Vogt said "It was such a great response by our guys. Erceg has been very good, but Will came up with a big swing and Big Christmas (Noel) again comes through."
Vinnie Pasquantino said "Tough way for us to go out, but we came in here and did what we needed to do."
Bo Naylor said "The competitive nature Clase attacks the game with and the mentality he goes out with, itâ€™s huge having him in the back end of a game."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians had been alone atop the division for 154 days until Kansas City pulled into a tie Tuesday
Eli Morgan pitched 1 1/3 scoreless innings for the victory
Bobby Witt Jr. continues to lead baseball with a.346 batting average, 185 hits and 114 runs
Others: Royals first baseman Vinnie Pasquantino had a career-high four hits
Guardians ace Tanner Bibee gave up five runs in five innings
